data.chText: 视力
data.enText: ability to see

data.chText: 视力；视觉
data.enText: the ability to see

data.chText: 失明
data.enText: to lose your sight (= to become blind)

data.chText: 她的视力很好。
data.enText: She has very good sight.

data.chText: 这种病影响了她的视力。
data.enText: The disease has affected her sight.

data.chText: 他右眼视力极弱。
data.enText: He has very little sight in his right eye.

data.chText: 看见
data.enText: act of seeing

data.chText: 看见
data.enText: the act of seeing sb/sth

data.chText: 我们在海上航行十天之后，首次看见陆地。
data.enText: After ten days at sea, we had our first sight of land.

data.chText: 大家都知道，我看到血就会昏倒。
data.enText: I have been known to faint at the sight of blood.

data.chText: 士兵得到命令，见人就射击。
data.enText: The soldiers were given orders to shoot on sight (= as soon as they saw sb) .

data.chText: 她看见远处有一辆汽车。
data.enText: She caught sight of a car in the distance.

data.chText: 视野
data.enText: how far you can see

data.chText: 视力范围；视野
data.enText: the area or distance within which sb can see or sth can be seen

data.chText: 一个人也看不见。
data.enText: There was no one in sight .

data.chText: 最后，我们看到了几座房屋。
data.enText: At last we came in sight of a few houses.

data.chText: 大路上出现了一辆自行车。
data.enText: A bicycle came into sight on the main road.

data.chText: 结局已现端倪。
data.enText: The end is in sight (= will happen soon) .

data.chText: 把贵重物品留在车里看不见的地方。
data.enText: Leave any valuables in your car out of sight .

data.chText: 不要露面。
data.enText: Keep out of sight (= stay where you cannot be seen) .

data.chText: 她从来不让女儿走出她的视线。
data.enText: She never lets her daughter out of her sight (= always keeps her where she can see her) .

data.chText: 滚开！
data.enText: Get out of my sight! (= Go away!)

data.chText: 那艘船从视野中消失了。
data.enText: The boat disappeared from sight .

data.chText: 房子藏在树林后面。
data.enText: The house was hidden from sight behind some trees.

data.chText: 当时他恰好出现在我的视线中。
data.enText: He had placed himself directly in my line of sight .

data.chText: 看见的事物
data.enText: what you can see

data.chText: 看见（或看得见）的事物；景象；情景
data.enText: a thing that you see or can see

data.chText: 一群红鹳飞向空中，景象十分壮观。
data.enText: It's a spectacular sight as the flamingos lift into the air.

data.chText: 博物馆试图再现战时英国的情景。
data.enText: The museum attempts to recreate the sights and sounds of wartime Britain.

data.chText: 他浑身湿透，打着寒战，一副凄惨的样子。
data.enText: He was a sorry sight , soaked to the skin and shivering.

data.chText: 如今在这个国家，这种鸟已罕见了。
data.enText: The bird is now a rare sight in this country.

data.chText: 好玩的地方
data.enText: interesting places

data.chText: 名胜；风景
data.enText: the interesting places, especially in a town or city, that are often visited by tourists

data.chText: 我们打算去巴黎过周末，参观那里的名胜。
data.enText: We're going to Paris for the weekend to see the sights .

data.chText: 可笑的 / 邋遢的人
data.enText: ridiculous/untidy person

data.chText: 滑稽可笑（或邋遢、脏乱、讨厌）的人（或物）
data.enText: a person or thing that looks ridiculous, untidy, unpleasant, etc.

data.chText: 她戴着那顶帽子，样子够滑稽的！
data.enText: She looks a sight in that hat!

data.chText: 枪炮；望远镜
data.enText: on gun/telescope

data.chText: 瞄准具；观测器
data.enText: a device that you look through to aim a gun, etc. or to look at sth through a telescope , etc.

data.chText: 他现在瞄准了那头鹿。
data.enText: He had the deer in his sights now.

data.chText: 她还是年轻演员的时候，就瞄准了好莱坞。
data.enText: Even as a young actress, she always had Hollywood firmly in her sights (= as her final goal) .
at first sight

data.chText: 乍一看；初看时
data.enText: when you first begin to consider sth

data.chText: 乍一看，对方给出的条件好像很优厚，但任何时候都不要小看那些小号字印刷的附加条款。
data.enText: At first sight, it may look like a generous offer, but always read the small print.

data.chText: 初次见到
data.enText: when you see sb/sth for the first time

data.chText: 我们一见钟情。
data.enText: It was love at first sight (= we fell in love the first time we saw each other) .
hate, be sick of, etc. the sight of sb/sth

data.chText: 十分厌恶；讨厌
data.enText: to hate, etc. sb/sth very much

data.chText: 我看见他就烦！
data.enText: I can't stand the sight of him!
in the sight of sb/in sb's sight

data.chText: 从某人的观点来看；在某人看来
data.enText: in sb's opinion

data.chText: 在上帝眼里我们都是平等的。
data.enText: We are all equal in the sight of God.
lose sight of sb/sth

data.chText: 再也见不着
data.enText: to become no longer able to see sb/sth

data.chText: 他们终于看不见陆地了。
data.enText: They finally lost sight of land.

data.chText: 忽略；忘记
data.enText: to stop considering sth; to forget sth

data.chText: 我们决不能忘记我们最初的目标。
data.enText: We must not lose sight of our original aim.
out of sight, out of mind

data.chText: 眼不见，心不想
data.enText: used to say sb will quickly be forgotten when they are no longer with you
raise/lower your sights

data.chText: 提高 / 降低要求；眼光变高 / 变低
data.enText: to expect more/less from a situation
set your sights on sth/on doing sth

data.chText: 以…为奋斗目标；决心做到
data.enText: to decide that you want sth and to try very hard to get it

data.chText: 她决心要上哈佛大学。
data.enText: She's set her sights on getting into Harvard.
a (damn, etc.) sight better, etc.
a (damn, etc.) sight too good, etc.

data.chText: （好）得多；非常（好）
data.enText: very much better; much too good, etc.

data.chText: 她干得比我强多了。
data.enText: She's done a darn sight better than I have.

data.chText: 它的价值比我原先想的高多了。
data.enText: It's worth a damn sight more than I thought.
a sight for sore eyes

data.chText: 喜欢见到的人（或物）；赏心悦目的事物
data.enText: a person or thing that you are pleased to see; something that is very pleasant to look at
sight unseen

data.chText: 在未见过的情况下；事先未经检查
data.enText: if you buy sth sight unseen , you do not have an opportunity to see it before you buy it
heave into sight/view

data.chText: 从远处出现；进入视野
data.enText: to appear, especially when moving gradually closer from a long way off

data.chText: （远处）出现了一条船。
data.enText: A ship hove into sight.

data.text: Hove is usually used for the past tense and past participle in this idiom.
这个习语通常用hove作过去式及过去分词。

data.enText: know sb by sight

data.chText: 与某人面熟
data.enText: to recognize sb without knowing them well
nowhere to be found/seen
nowhere in sight

data.chText: 不可能找到（或看见）
data.enText: impossible for anyone to find or see

data.chText: 根本看不到孩子们在哪儿。
data.enText: The children were nowhere to be seen.

data.chText: 近期内看不到和平解决的可能。
data.enText: A peace settlement is nowhere in sight (= is not likely in the near future) .
not a pretty sight

data.chText: 不顺眼；有碍观瞻
data.enText: not pleasant to look at

data.chText: 你应该见识见识他穿游泳裤的样子——真是一景呢！
data.enText: You should have seen him in his swimming trunks─not a pretty sight!

data.chText: 看到，发现（期待的事物）
data.enText: to suddenly see sth, especially sth you have been looking for

data.chText: 在海上航行十二天后他们看到了陆地。
data.enText: After twelve days at sea, they sighted land.

data.chText: 以上各词均指视力范围、视野。
data.enText: These are all words for the area or distance that you can see from a particular position.
sight

data.chText: 指视力范围、视野：
data.enText: the area or distance that you can see from a particular position

data.chText: 他朝街上望去，一个人也没看见。
data.enText: He looked up the street, but there was no one in sight.

data.chText: 把贵重物品留在车里看不见的地方。
data.enText: Leave any valuables in your car out of sight.
view

data.chText: 指视力范围、视野：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) the area or distance that you can see from a particular position

data.chText: 那湖很快便映入眼帘。
data.enText: The lake soon came into view.
vision

data.chText: 指视野：
data.enText: the area that you can see from a particular position

data.chText: 这对夫妇离开了她的视野。
data.enText: The couple moved outside her field of vision (= total area you can see from a particular position) .

data.chText: 用sight、view还是vision？
view较sight和vision书面化，是其中唯一指视野清晰程度的词：
data.enText: View is more literary than sight or vision . It is the only word for talking about how well you can see.
I didn't have a good sight/vision of the stage.

data.chText: vision总是与物主代词连用：
data.enText: Vision must always be used with a possessive pronoun.

data.chText: 我／他／她…的视野
data.enText: my/his/her etc. (field of) vision

data.chText: vision不与介词in、into和out of连用，但sight和view常与这些介词连用：
data.enText: It is not used with the prepositions in , into and out of that are very frequent with sight and view .
There was nobody in vision.
A tall figure came into vision.
sight, view or vision?
in/out of sight/view
in/within sight/view of sth
in full/plain sight/view
to come into/disappear from sight/view/sb's vision
to vanish from sight/view
to come in sight/view of sb/sth
to block sb's view/vision
sb's line of sight/vision
sb's field of view/vision

data.text: view ♦ sight ♦ scene ♦ vista ♦ panorama ♦ spectacle

data.chText: 以上各词均指景色，尤指从某处看到的风景。
data.enText: These are all words for a thing that you can see, especially from a particular place.
view

data.chText: 指从某处看到的景色、风景，尤指自然美景：
data.enText: what you can see from a particular place or position, especially beautiful natural scenery

data.chText: 这小屋可以看到宜人的海景。
data.enText: The cottage had a delightful sea view.
sight

data.chText: 指看见或看得见的事物、景象，尤指壮观、奇特的景象：
data.enText: a thing that you see or can see, especially sth that is impressive or unusual

data.chText: 一群红鹳飞向空中，景象十分壮观。
data.enText: It's a spectacular sight as the flamingos lift into the air.
scene

data.chText: 指景象、景色，尤指有人和／或动物活动的风光：
data.enText: a view that you see, especially one with people and/or animals moving about and doing things

data.chText: 那是赏心悦目的乡村风光。
data.enText: It was a delightful rural scene.
vista

data.chText: 指美景、狭长的景观，如树木或建筑物间的景观
data.enText: ( literary ) a beautiful view; a long, narrow view, for example between rows of trees or buildings
panorama

data.chText: 指全景：
data.enText: a view of a wide area of land

data.chText: 从塔上可看到壮丽的布拉格全景。
data.enText: The tower offers a breathtaking panorama of Prague.
spectacle

data.chText: 指壮观、迷人的景象：
data.enText: ( literary ) a sight or view that is very impressive or attracts a lot of attention

data.chText: 成千上万的动物在辽阔的平原上活动构成了令人赞叹的奇观。
data.enText: The wide plain, with thousands of animals on the move, was an awesome spectacle.
a view/vista/panorama of/from…
a beautiful view/sight/scene/vista/panorama/spectacle
a spectacular view/sight/vista/panorama
a sad/sorry sight/scene/spectacle
an industrial/urban view/scene
to admire/take in the view/sight/scene/vista/panorama/spectacle

means: 滑稽可笑（或邋遢、脏乱、讨厌）的人（或物）

ex.chText: 那次落日真是一幅美景。
ex.enText: The sunset was a very beautiful sight.

ex.chText: 她去巴黎观光了。
ex.enText: She went out to see the sights of Paris.

ex.chText: 长城是世界上最壮观的景象之一。
ex.enText: The Great Wall is one of the most breathtaking sights in the world.

synonyms.bx: 指眼见的景色，如城市景象或自然风光，也指人造景物或奇特的景象。

ex.chText: 这幢新的建筑破坏了景色。
ex.enText: The new building is a blot on the landscape.

ex.chText: 那是一幅描绘秋天景色的油画。
ex.enText: That is an oil painting of a landscape in autumn.

ex.chText: 两座小山连同山谷构成了一幅美丽的风景。
ex.enText: The two hills with the valley formed a beautiful landscape.

synonyms.bx: 指陆地上有山、有水的自然风光。

ex.chText: 到达山顶时，他们看到眼前是一片令人惊叹的景色。
ex.enText: Arriving at the top of the hill, they saw a most impressive scene before them.

ex.chText: 暑假期间她拍摄下丰富多彩的街景。
ex.enText: She photographed a wide range of street scenes during her summer vacation.

ex.chText: 花瓶上绘饰着田园景色。
ex.enText: The vase was painted with pastoral scenes.

synonyms.bx: 指某地方、图画等中的景色。

ex.chText: 这里的草原风景是无与伦比的。
ex.enText: The grassland scenery here is unrivalled.

ex.chText: 瑞士以制表业和美丽的风景而闻名。
ex.enText: Switzerland is famous for its watchmaking and beautiful scenery.

synonyms.bx: 指某一国家或地区的群山、森林等自然风景。

ex.chText: 我想坐在这里看城市的全景。
ex.enText: I want to sit here and look at the panoramic view of the city.

ex.chText: 从山顶看到的景色非常壮观。
ex.enText: The view from the hilltop is magnificent.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指从远处或高处所见的全景，尤指美景。

ex.chText: 夜视能力
ex.enText: night vision

ex.chText: 这会导致失明或视力严重受损。
ex.enText: It causes blindness or serious loss of vision.

ex.chText: 20分钟之后，那辆车离开了她的视野。
ex.enText: Twenty minutes later, the car moved outside her field of vision.

synonyms.bx: 指人的视力或目力所及的范围。

ex.chText: 那个小孩的视力有问题。
ex.enText: There was a problem with the child's eyesight.

ex.chText: 哪种动物的视力最敏锐？
ex.enText: Which animal has the keenest eyesight?

synonyms.bx: 尤指眼睛看东西的功能。

ex.chText: 视力正常/不佳
ex.enText: normal/poor sight/eyesight/vision

ex.chText: 所有小学生都可以免费检查视力。
ex.enText: All students in primary schools can get a free sight/eyesight/vision test.

ex.chText: 一看到他，她就生气。
ex.enText: Just the sight of him made her angry.

synonyms.bx: 表示“视力”时，可与 eyesight, vision 换用；也可指眼睛“看到”这一动作。

ex.zh: 将某人/某物保持在视野内

data.chText: 乍一看；初看时
data.enText: when you first begin to consider sth

data.chText: 乍一看，对方给出的条件好像很优厚，但任何时候都不要小看那些小号字印刷的附加条款。
data.enText: At first sight, it may look like a generous offer, but always read the small print.

data.enText: It was love at first sight (= we fell in love the first time we saw each other) .

data.enText: I can't stand the sight of him!

data.chText: 她决心要上哈佛大学。
data.enText: She's set her sights on getting into Harvard.

a (damn, etc.) sight too good, etc.

data.chText: 她干得比我强多了。

data.chText: 它的价值比我原先想的高多了。
data.enText: It's worth a damn sight more than I thought.

data.chText: 喜欢见到的人（或物）；赏心悦目的事物
data.enText: a person or thing that you are pleased to see; something that is very pleasant to look at
sight unseen

data.chText: 在未见过的情况下；事先未经检查
data.enText: if you buy sth sight unseen , you do not have an opportunity to see it before you buy it
heave into sight/view

data.enText: to appear, especially when moving gradually closer from a long way off

data.chText: （远处）出现了一条船。
data.enText: A ship hove into sight.

data.text: Hove is usually used for the past tense and past participle in this idiom.
这个习语通常用hove作过去式及过去分词。

data.enText: know sb by sight

data.chText: 与某人面熟
data.enText: to recognize sb without knowing them well
nowhere to be found/seen
nowhere in sight

data.chText: 不可能找到（或看见）
data.enText: impossible for anyone to find or see

data.chText: 根本看不到孩子们在哪儿。
data.enText: The children were nowhere to be seen.

data.chText: 近期内看不到和平解决的可能。
data.enText: A peace settlement is nowhere in sight (= is not likely in the near future) .
not a pretty sight

data.chText: 不顺眼；有碍观瞻
data.enText: not pleasant to look at

data.chText: 你应该见识见识他穿游泳裤的样子——真是一景呢！
data.enText: You should have seen him in his swimming trunks─not a pretty sight!

tr: the act of looking or seeing or observing
example: he tried to get a better view of it
his survey of the battlefield was limited
the sight of his wife brought him back to reality
the train was an unexpected sight
in his sight she could do no wrong
he was a familiar sight on the television
they went to Paris to see the sights

tr: (often followed by `of') a large number or amount or extent
example: he made a mint on the stock market
see the rest of the winners in our huge passel of photos
he caught sight of the king's men coming over the ridge

tr: take aim by looking through the sights of a gun (or other device)

value.def: Someone's sight is their ability to see.

example.ex: My sight is failing, and I can't see to read any more...
example.tran: 我的视力在下降，看不了书了。

example.ex: I use the sense of sound much more than the sense of sight.
example.tran: 我用听觉比视觉要多得多。

value.def: The sight of something is the act of seeing it or an occasion on which you see it.

example.ex: I faint at the sight of blood...
example.tran: 我一见到血就晕。

example.ex: The sight of him entering a room could flood her with desire.
example.tran: 见到他进入房间会让她心中欲望澎湃。

value.def: A sight is something that you see.

example.ex: The practice of hanging clothes across the street is a common sight in many parts of the city...
example.tran: 街边晾晒衣服在这座城市的许多地区随处可见。

example.ex: We encountered the pathetic sight of a family packing up its home...
example.tran: 我们目睹了一家人正在收拾家当准备离开的凄惨景象。

example.ex: Among the most spectacular sights are the great sea-bird colonies.
example.tran: 庞大的海鸟群是最壮观的景象之一。

gramarinfo.label: usu with supp, oft adj N

value.def: If you sight someone or something, you suddenly see them, often briefly.

example.ex: The security forces sighted a group of young men that had crossed the border...
example.tran: 安全部队突然看见一群越过边境的年轻人。

example.ex: A fleet of French ships was sighted in the North Sea.
example.tran: 在北海突然发现了一支法国船队。

value.def: The sights of a weapon such as a rifle are the part which helps you aim it more accurately.
The sights are the places that are interesting to see and that are often visited by tourists.

example.ex: We'd toured the sights of Paris...
example.tran: 我们游览了巴黎的风景名胜。

example.ex: I am going to show you the sights of our wonderful city...
example.tran: 我会带你浏览我们这座美丽城市的风景名胜。

example.ex: Once at Elgin day-trippers visit a number of local sights.
example.tran: 一到达埃尔金，一日游的游客就参观了一些当地的风景名胜。

value.def: You can use a sight to mean a lot. For example, if you say that something is a sight worse than it was before, you are emphasizing that it is much worse than it was.

example.ex: She's been no more difficult than most daughters and a sight better than some I could mention...
example.tran: 与大多数女儿相比，她并不算太难管，而且比我知道的一些要乖巧得多。

example.ex: We weren't doing anything different to what we've always done. We're just doing it a damn sight quicker.
example.tran: 我们正在做的事和我们一直在做的别无二致，只不过我们现在动作要快得多。

value.def: If you catch sight of someone, you suddenly see them, often briefly.

example.ex: Then he caught sight of her small black velvet hat in the crowd...
example.tran: 然后他突然在人群中看见了她那顶小巧的黑色天鹅绒帽子。

example.ex: Every time I catch sight of myself in the mirror, I feel so disappointed.
example.tran: 每次我瞥见镜子里的自己就觉得沮丧。

value.def: If you say that something seems to have certain characteristics at first sight, you mean that it appears to have the features you describe when you first see it but later it is found to be different.

example.ex: It promised to be a more difficult undertaking than might appear at first sight...
example.tran: 那项任务可能比乍看之下还要困难。

example.ex: At first sight it resembles a traditional village of two-storeyed, balconied houses, set among well-tended gardens.
example.tran: 乍一看，它就像个传统的村庄：带阳台的两层楼房坐落于精心照料的花园中。

value.tran: 乍一看;一见之下;初看时

value.def: If something is in sight or within sight, you can see it. If it is out of sight, you cannot see it.

example.ex: The sandy beach was in sight...
example.tran: 沙滩映入眼帘。

example.ex: The Atlantic coast is within sight of the hotel...
example.tran: 从宾馆可以看见大西洋海岸。

example.ex: My companion suggested that we park out of sight of passing traffic to avoid attracting attention.
example.tran: 我的同伴建议我们将车停在过往车辆看不见的地方，以免引起注意。

value.def: If a result or a decision is in sight or within sight, it is likely to happen within a short time.

example.ex: An agreement on many aspects of trade policy was in sight...
example.tran: 一项涉及到贸易政策诸多方面的协议即将达成。

example.ex: There is no end in sight to the struggle for power...
example.tran: 权力的争斗近期不会终止。

example.ex: She was within sight of Navratilova's record of seventy-four consecutive wins.
example.tran: 她已经逼近了纳夫拉蒂洛娃 74 连胜的纪录。

value.tran: 在望;在即;临近;即将产生

value.def: If you lose sight of an important aspect of something, you no longer pay attention to it because you are worrying about less important things.

example.ex: In some cases, US industry has lost sight of customer needs in designing products...
example.tran: 某些情况下，美国工业在产品设计上忽略了客户的需求。

example.ex: We shouldn't lose sight of the fact that education is important for its own sake.
example.tran: 教育本身就很重要，我们不应忽视这一事实。

value.def: If you know someone by sight, you can recognize them when you see them, although you have never met them and talked to them.

example.ex: I knew him by sight but had never spoken with him.
example.tran: 我和他有过几面之缘，但从未说过话。

value.def: If you say 'out of sight, out of mind', you mean that people quickly forget someone if he or she goes away.

example.ex: The problems of the poor are largely invisible—out of sight, out of mind.
example.tran: 穷人的问题人们大多看不见——正所谓“眼不见，心不烦”。

value.def: If someone is ordered to do something on sight, they have to do it without delay, as soon as a person or thing is seen.

example.ex: Troops shot anyone suspicious on sight...
example.tran: 部队士兵一见到任何可疑的人马上就开枪。

example.ex: Magee was set free but British authorities were asked to arrest him on sight.
example.tran: 马吉被释放了，但是英国当局却被要求一见到他就立即逮捕。

value.def: If you say that someone or something is not a pretty sight, you mean that it is not pleasant to look at.

example.ex: The bathroom is not a pretty sight. The wallpaper's peeling, the tiles are crumbling.
example.tran: 浴室破旧不堪。墙纸剥落了，瓷砖也裂了。

value.tran: 不好看;不雅观;有碍观瞻

value.def: If you set your sights on something, you decide that you want it and try hard to get it.

example.ex: They have set their sights on the world record...
example.tran: 他们的目标是冲击世界纪录。

example.ex: Although she came from a family of bankers, Franklin set her sights on a career in scientific research.
example.tran: 尽管出身于银行家家庭，富兰克林还是决心从事科研事业。

value.tran: 以…为奋斗目标;志在必得;决心做到

value.def: If you agree to buy something sight unseen, you agree to buy it, even though you have not seen it and do not know what condition it is in.

example.ex: Although people sometimes buy property sight unseen, it's a remarkably bad idea.
example.tran: 尽管人们有时没看房就买了房，但这真是一个很糟糕的主意。

value.tran: 在未见实物的情况下;事先未经检查
